alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 4:05PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Yukon River between Tanana and the Nowitna River. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas along the Yukon River between Tanana and Nowitna River. Flooding of low lying roads in Tanana is occuring and will continue this weekend. Water may rise very slowly at Tanana through Saturday, but flooding in Tanana is expected to remain minor. Flooding is worse along the Yukon River from the Nowitna River upstream to Kallands, and for the Nowitna River 20 to 30 miles upstream of the Yukon. Water levels are expected to fluctuate and may rise slowly through Saturday. Ice will push on shore in low lying areas near the river bank downstream of Kallands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM AKDT, On Friday afternoon, an ice jam remains in place on the Yukon River 20 miles upstream of Ruby. The ice jam is about 40 miles long with ice tightly packed together upstream to Birches. Extensive flooding has now formed a large lake along and upstream of the ice jam. Satellite imagery shows that flooding is occuring 20 to 30 miles up the Nowitna River, and along the Yukon River from the Nowitna River upstream to Kallands. Water is backed up all the way to Tanana, with minor flooding of low lying roads occuring in Tanana. The ice is now getting wet and weakening under the sun, and the ice jam is expected to let loose sometime between tonight and Sunday. When the jam releases, water will slowly drain back into the river, but water could remain in some low lying areas for many days. - Minor flooding in Tanana of low lying roads in Tanana is expected to continue into the weekend. Water levels may rise very slowly over the next day at Tanana, but flooding is expected to remain in low lying areas. Flooding is worse along the Yukon River near the Nowitna River and for 20 to 30 miles up the Nowitna River. Water levels are expected to fluctuate and may rise slowly through Saturday. Ice will push on shore in low lying areas near the river bank downstream of Kallands. - For Tanana: At 8:00am the stage was 86.22 feet. Flood Stage is 86.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River between the Nowitna River and Tanana, or along the lower Nowitna River, stay take action to protect yourself from flooding.
info.instruction: People along the Yukon River between Tanana and the Nowitna River should prepare for high water. Move valuables away from the river to higher ground.
